author: arizfaiyaz
message: fix(curriculum): Add interactive examples to * selector lesson (#62772)

files.patch:
@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ challengeType: 19 dashedName: what-is-the-universal-selector --- -# --description-- +# --interactive-- The universal selector (`*`) is a special type of CSS selector that matches any element in the document. @@ -15,13 +15,24 @@ The universal selector can be used to select all elements within a specific cont Here is an example of using the universal selector for setting the `margin` and `padding` for the entire HTML document: +:::interactive_editor + +```html + + +

Heading element

+

example paragraph element

+``` + ```css * { margin: 0; padding: 0; } ``` +::: + In this code example, the `*` selector resets the margin and padding of all elements to zero, which is a common technique used in CSS resets. The universal selector has the lowest specificity value of any selector. It contributes 0 to all parts of the specificity value `(0, 0, 0, 0)`. @@ -30,6 +41,8 @@ This means that any other selector, including type selectors, class selectors, I Let's take a look at the following HTML and CSS example: +:::interactive_editor + ```html
